question: Sebuah petir terlihat cahayanya. Setelah 3 sekon kemudian baru terdengar suara guntur. jika cepat rambat bunyi di udara 330 m/s. hitung jarak terjadinya petir.

answers.answer:
Kecepatan rambat bunyi 330 m/s,,
Dalam waktu 3 detik,,,

330 m/s X 3 s = 990 meter,,,

related_questions.question: Tolong dong buatin monologue berbahasa inggris tentang museum , pake opening sama closing juga .. :D

answers.answer: Hi all, today I would like to share with all of you why I really in love with Museum, Why do I love with it? First, Museum keeps all the civilization history of human being, from thousand years ago. When I went to my first museum, namely Louvre in Paris, I felt like I walked from 5000 years ago to recent moment. Second, Museum teach us how to be wise, it is due to the ability of Museum in conveying the story about war and its wisdom behind it. After all I recommend you to go to museum as often as possible.

related_questions.question: Tolong buatin dialog narative cerita rakyat 4 pemain

answers.answer: One day while a mousedeer was walking in the forest, he saw a big black snake sleeping under the tree. When he saw the snake, the mousedeer was frightened. When he wanted to run away from the snake, he suddenly fell on top of a tiger which was sleeping not far from the snake. The tiger woke up and took of the mousedeer. He told the mousedeer that he was going to eat him for lunch. “Please don’t eat me now,” said the mousedeer. “I have something important to do.”             “Look,” said the mousedeer. “That is the king’s belt. He asked me to stay here and watch it while he was away in the forest.” The tiger looked at the snake and said, “That is a beautiful belt. I need a belt like that. Can I wear it?” He asked the mousedeer.             “Oh all right,” said the mousedeer. So he picked up the snake and winded it around the tiger. Then the snake woke up and saw the tiger. The snake twisted itself tighter until the tiger couldn’t breathe. The tiger asked the mousedeer to help him. But the mousedeer turned and ran away into the forest.

related_questions.question:
Berikan penjelasan tentang penyakit-penyakit ini menggunakan Bahasa Inggris:    Headache,sprained ankle,stomachache,temperature,sore throat,toothache,cough,cold.
Misalnya:
Sakit kepala disebabkan oleh ..... dsb (menggunakan Bahasa Inggris)

answers.answer:
Headache is pain or discomfort in the head, scalp, or neck.
Ankle Sprained is injuries to joints, ligaments caused by stretching beyond the capacity of the ankle.
Stomachache is pain or tenderness that only occurs in the stomach.
Temperature is a numerical measure of cold and heat.
Sore throat is a disease in the throat caused by a virus or bacteria.
Toothache  is a disease caused by dental cavities or infection.
Sough is a natural reflex that protects your lungs, caused by a virus or bacteria.
Cold is caused by an infection in the body. The infection can be caused by viruses, bacteria, fungi and parasites.

related_questions.question:
Materi tentang Giving, Attention the speaker????


Please dong......!!!

answers.answer:
Giving Attention
1.      The Definition of Gaining AttentionGaining attention is a way or expression that is spoken so that other people will pay their attention to what we want to.2.      Expressions We Can Use to Ask Other People Attention Here are some expressions we can use to ask aother people attention.1)     Attention, please!2)     May/can I have your attention, please?3)     Look!4)     Look here!5)     Excuse me!6)     Excuse me, look here!7)     Listen to me, please.8)     Waiter?9)     I’m sorry, but ….10)Wow, really?11)Excuse me, look here, please.12)I’m listening. Example :  Some of the examples by which you can showcase your keen attention to detail to the interviewer are:
1. Talk about job role specifications and try understanding the deliverables. Ask questions.
2. Try exhibiting your knowledge about the organization, the teams involved, the current market scenario and how the organization is trying to tackle the situations.
Lack of attention to detail
Lack of attention to detail is not really a good trait.
In fact, it is something that most of the employers look down upon. After all, no one wants to hire a lazy bum who pays no attention to details!
How to improve attention to details
Anyone can improve his/her attention to details. All that is required is an intent and focus to achieve it. Perhaps, the best way to develop the trait is to start paying attention to things around you

related_questions.question:
Fill in the blanks with the past tense of the verbs
we not take our passports

answers.answer:
we didn't take our passports?

we not took our passports

rumus : s + did + not + v1 + o
we didn't take our passports / we did not take our passports
